text.tspan: Urban sanitation facilities vs. rural sanitation facilities, 2015
The share of the urban population with access to improved sanitation facilities versus the share of rural population
with improved sanitation facilities. Improved sanitation facilities are likely to ensure hygienic separation of human
excreta from human contact. They include flush/pour flush (to piped sewer system, septic tank, pit latrine), ventilated
improved pit (VIP) latrine, pit latrine with slab, and composting toilet.
Improved sanitation facilities, rural (% of rural population with access)
Improved sanitation facilities, urban (% of urban population with
